+
+import net.runelite.client.config.Config;
+import net.runelite.client.config.ConfigGroup;
+import net.runelite.client.config.ConfigItem;
+
+@ConfigGroup("wiki")
+public interface WikiConfig extends Config
+{
+
+	@ConfigItem(
+		keyName = "swapLookupSearch",
+		name = "Swap Lookup and Search",
+		description = "Swap Lookup to left-click Search on the Wiki button",
+		position = 1
+	)
+	default boolean swapLookupSearch()
+	{
+		return false;
+	}
+

nodes.bodyText: Remove added whitespace
You should probably use addWidgets instead of startUp and move the code in shutDown to a new method instead and call that here.
How does this look now?

nodes.bodyText: I think this name is a bit ambiguous, it's not clear to me what will happen when i toggle the option. Something like Leftclick Search would be better imo.

nodes.bodyText: Remove the clientThread from here invocation and invoke it similarily to addWidgets with `clientThread.invokeLater(this::removeWidgets)
This comment feels outdated
This comment feels redundant, the code right below it tells us the same thing
position feels a bit broad and could have a better name. Isn't it actually the index of the search op?
It's the index but I don't personally understand the order (if there's only 3 elements in the array... why is position 4 on top 😄)
there are 10 slots in the array, and the optarget is as if it is in slot 4½, so you have to use something <=4 to put it before, and >=5 to put it after
That makes sense. Thanks!
I don't fully understand why this is position + 1 but it was case 6 earlier so i guess it's fine
javascriptcallback lives in cs2 land with 1 based indexes, setAction is in engine land with 0 based indexes
use a single invokeLater here
